definition: to take an oath to do sth/to pledge/to vow
arrow/dart/straight/to vow/to swear/old variant of 屎[shi3]
aspiration/ambition/the will
sign/mark/to record/to write a footnote

sentences.english: Once the breakthrough is still to be committed smiles and life.
sentences.chinese: 一旦突围仍是矢志不移的笑面人生。

sentences.english: He serves me most, who serves his country best – Homer.
sentences.chinese: 他对我矢志不渝，而我对国家忠贞不二。

sentences.english: I am willing to total spectrum lasting love song.
sentences.chinese: 我愿与你共谱矢志不移的恋歌。

sentences.english: We are committed to no rigid formula.
sentences.chinese: 我们未必矢志坚持任何硬性方案。

sentences.english: The secret of success is consstancy of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 成功的秘诀在于矢志不渝的坚持。

sentences.english: The sea on the reef vowed to love, I also look on the reef.
sentences.chinese: 大海对礁石矢志不渝的爱，令我对礁石也刮目相看。

sentences.english: Chen Du - xiu had been pursuing socialism before he degraded himself into a Trotskyite .
sentences.chinese: 社会主义是陈独秀蜕变为托派以前矢志不渝的追求。

sentences.english: The person who makes a success of living is the one who sees his goal steading and aims for it unswervingly.
sentences.chinese: 取得卓越成就的人必然是目标坚定且矢志不渝的人。

sentences.english: The sea on the reef vowed to love, I also look on the reef .
sentences.chinese: 大海对礁石矢志不渝的爱，令我对礁石也刮目相看。

sentences.english: You say, love is only one, we so lucky, our commitment.
sentences.chinese: 你说，爱是独一，我们那么幸运，我们矢志不渝。

sentences.english: Ensure that our customers success is our unwavering goal.
sentences.chinese: 确保客户的成功是我们矢志不渝的目标。

sentences.english: He is a determined person, persistent in pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个执着的人，对于自己的追求矢志不渝。

sentences.english: Her mother was a dedicated apostle of healthy eating.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲是健康饮食矢志不渝的倡导者。
矢志不移地追求你的爱恋。

sentences.english: America’s commitment to global security will never waver.
sentences.chinese: 美国将矢志不渝地致力于确保全球安全。

definition: to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country
to be determined/to be resolved
unswerving/unflinching
steadfast/with single-minded devotion
whetstone/(fig.) to hone/to temper/to encourage
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
to dedicate oneself to the cause of one's country (idiom)
lit. to open one's liver and drip gall (idiom); wholehearted loyalty
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
great goal/magnificent aspiration
the mission in life of a deceased person, left to others to carry on
diligent and tireless (idiom)
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
to pledge one's life
aspiration
